subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Parts of speech are categories of words based on their function in a sentence.
points: They form the basic structure of grammar.
They help in constructing meaningful sentences.

subsections.title: Types
subsections.content: There are eight main parts of speech.
points: Noun – names a person, place, thing, or idea.
Pronoun – replaces a noun (he, she, it).
Verb – shows action or state (run, is).
Adjective – describes a noun (beautiful).
Adverb – describes a verb or adjective (quickly).
Preposition – shows position or relationship (on, in).
Conjunction – joins words or groups (and, but).
Interjection – expresses emotion (wow, oh!).

subsections.title: Examples
subsections.content: Examples help in understanding each part clearly.
points: 'Run' is a verb.
'Beautiful' is an adjective.
'He' is a pronoun.
'Quickly' is an adverb.

subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Tenses indicate the time of action or state of being.
points: They help us understand when something happened.
Tense affects verb forms.

subsections.title: Main Types
subsections.content: There are three main types of tenses.
points: Present – action is happening now (e.g., She eats).
Past – action happened before (e.g., She ate).
Future – action will happen (e.g., She will eat).

subsections.title: Usage
subsections.content: Each tense is used in specific contexts.
points: Use present for habits or current events.
Use past for completed actions.
Use future for planned or expected actions.

subsections.title: Types of Letters
subsections.content: Letters are categorized as formal or informal.
points: Formal letters – used in official settings.
Informal letters – used in personal communication.

subsections.title: Structure of a Letter
subsections.content: All letters follow a common structure.
points: Sender's address.
Date of writing.
Salutation (Dear Sir/Madam or Dear John).
Body – the main message.
Closing – Yours sincerely / Yours faithfully.

subsections.title: Purpose
subsections.content: Letters serve different purposes depending on the type.
points: Formal: job application, complaint, inquiry.
Informal: sharing news, inviting, thanking.
